default.title: Early 20th Century– ~50 years
default.description: Widespread use of vaccines, better medicine, and reduced infant mortality raised life expectancy significantly.

default.title: Post-WWII Modernization – ~60 years
default.description: Antibiotics, public health systems, clean water, and better nutrition accelerated gains.

default.title: Early 21st Century – ~67 years
default.description: Most countries benefited from modern medicine. Some developed nations saw averages >75 years.

default.title: Today – ~73 years
default.description: High-income countries: 80–85 years. Low-income countries: 60–65 years. Major threats include chronic diseases, lifestyle illnesses, and pandemics like COVID-19.
